duties_responsibilities.duty: Direct and supervise the day-to-day functions of assigned clinics in accordance with federal, state, and local standards, guidelines, and regulations.
Responsible for carrying out all established policies, working with and building alignment with medical providers, staff, and hospital administration.
Operational oversight for the Primary Care Specialty with 7 practice locations and 14 providers.
Responsible for routine business and clinical functions of the assigned practice and develops, implements, and monitors annual practice budgets.
Monitors purchases for each practice and plans corrective strategies when order levels are excessive in volume or cost.
Selects, hires, and evaluates practice management staff and recommends professional development for staff.
Develops and maintains effective communications between all levels of personnel and ensures regulatory compliance.
Develops and oversees implementation and administration of internal practice policies and procedures in conjunction with Physician Services standard policies and procedures.
Interprets applicable laws, rules and regulations and ensures the practice is in compliance with them.

Coordinates continuity of patient care with external healthcare organizations and facilities and referrals from the primary care provider to a specialty care provider for practices certified as Patient Center Medical Homes.
Participates on a team for data collection, health outcomes reporting, audits, and programmatic evaluation related to Patient Centered Medical Home.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in health or business administration is preferred. Appropriate experience may be substituted for educational requirements.
